<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 418, 221, 432]]<|/det|>
## INSTRUCTIONS  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 434, 880, 636]]<|/det|>
INSTRUCTIONS- Answer all questions.- Use a black or dark blue pen. You may use an HB pencil for any diagrams or graphs.- Write your name, centre number and candidate number in the boxes at the top of the page.- Write your answer to each question in the space provided.- Do not use an erasable pen or correction fluid.- Do not write on any bar codes.- If additional space is needed, you should use the lined page at the end of this booklet; the question number or numbers must be clearly shown.- You should use a calculator where appropriate.- You must show all necessary working clearly; no marks will be given for unsupported answers from a calculator.- Give non- exact numerical answers correct to 3 significant figures, or 1 decimal place for angles in degrees, unless a different level of accuracy is specified in the question.  

<|ref|>sub_title<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 664, 211, 678]]<|/det|>
## INFORMATION  

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[92, 680, 728, 711]]<|/det|>
INFORMATION- The total mark for this paper is 75.- The number of marks for each question or part question is shown in brackets [ ].

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 96, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>1</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 72, 146, 88]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 72, 677, 88]]<|/det|>
Use standard results from the list of formulae (MF19) to show that

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[351, 106, 645, 151]]<|/det|>
\[\sum_{r = 1}^{n}(2 - 3r)(5 - 3r) = an^{3} + bn^{2} + cn,\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 165, 522, 182]]<|/det|>
where \(a\) , \(b\) and \(c\) are integers to be determined.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 165, 920, 182]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 196, 917, 928]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 75, 96, 93]]<|/det|>
<label>2</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 534, 95]]<|/det|>
The cubic equation \(x^{3} + 2x + 1 = 0\) has roots \(\alpha , \beta , \gamma\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 107, 146, 125]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 107, 631, 126]]<|/det|>
Find a cubic equation whose roots are \(\alpha^3 - 1\), \(\beta^3 - 1\), \(\gamma^3 - 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 107, 920, 126]]<|/det|>
<mark>[3]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 138, 917, 945]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 81, 146, 98]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 77, 547, 100]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 79, 920, 100]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 73, 737, 92]]<|/det|>
The sequence \(u_{1}\) , \(u_{2}\) , \(u_{3}\) , â€¦ is such that \(u_{1} = 5\) and \(u_{n + 1} = 6u_{n} + 5\) for \(n \geqslant 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 104, 146, 122]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 104, 638, 122]]<|/det|>
Prove by induction that \(u_{n} = 6^{n} - 1\) for all positive integers \(n\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 104, 920, 122]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 133, 918, 821]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 835, 148, 853]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 835, 504, 853]]<|/det|>
Deduce that \(u_{2n}\) is divisible by \(u_n\) for \(n \geqslant 1\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 835, 920, 853]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 84, 96, 103]]<|/det|>
<label>4</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[119, 75, 692, 109]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{M}\) is given by \(\mathbf{M} = \begin{pmatrix} 1 & 2 \\ 0 & 1 \end{pmatrix} \begin{pmatrix} \cos \theta & -\sin \theta \\ \sin \theta & \cos \theta \end{pmatrix}\) , where \(0 < \theta < 2\pi\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 125, 146, 144]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 125, 851, 144]]<|/det|>
The matrix \(\mathbf{M}\) represents a sequence of two geometrical transformations in the \(x - y\) plane.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 157, 920, 176]]<|/det|>
State the type of each transformation, and make clear the order in which they are applied. [2]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 190, 917, 547]]<|/det|>


<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[117, 560, 148, 578]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 560, 920, 578]]<|/det|>
Find the value of \(\theta\) for which the transformation represented by \(\mathbf{M}\) has a line of invariant points. [7]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 78, 570, 100]]<|/det|>
The curve \(C\) has polar equation \(r = \theta \mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{\mathrm{i}}\theta}\) , for \(0 \leqslant \theta \leqslant 2\pi\) .

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 110, 146, 129]]<|/det|>
<label>(a)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 110, 235, 129]]<|/det|>
Sketch \(C\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[890, 110, 920, 129]]<|/det|>
<mark>[2]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[116, 406, 146, 425]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 406, 918, 445]]<|/det|>
Find the area of the region bounded by \(C\) and the initial line, giving your answer in the form \(\left(p\pi^2 + q\pi + r\right)\mathrm{e}^{\frac{1}{2}\pi} + s\) , where \(p\) , \(q\) , \(r\) and \(s\) are integers to be determined. [6]

<|ref|>image<|/ref|><|det|>[[153, 457, 917, 945]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[114, 241, 144, 259]]<|/det|>
<label>(c)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[156, 241, 598, 259]]<|/det|>
Show that, at the point of \(C\) furthest from the initial line,

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[395, 268, 603, 295]]<|/det|>
\[\theta \cos \theta +\left(\frac{1}{8}\theta +1\right)\sin \theta = 0\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 304, 618, 322]]<|/det|>
and verify that this equation has a root between 5 and 5.05.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[892, 304, 920, 322]]<|/det|>
<mark>[5]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[79, 72, 94, 90]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 72, 435, 90]]<|/det|>

<|ref|>equation<|/ref|><|det|>[[374, 102, 623, 120]]<|/det|>
\[\mathbf{i} - 2\mathbf{k},\quad \mathbf{i} + 2\mathbf{j} + 2\mathbf{k},\quad 2\mathbf{i} - \mathbf{j} - \mathbf{k},\]

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[118, 134, 220, 152]]<|/det|>
respectively.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[154, 554, 551, 594]]<|/det|>
